pull.title: build: Drop 32-bit build configurations for MSVC
pull.body:
A 32-bit application for Windows in 2021 looks outdated. I'm pretty sure no one is going to run Bitcoin Core v23.0 on 32-bit Windows.

Also see #15939.

events.body:
Concept ACK

Somewhat related:
* _"As the number of developers testing on these platforms decrease the probability of errors due to incorrect assumptions about `sizeof(size_t)`, `sizeof(time_t)` and `sizeof(long)` is likely to increase."_ (from PR #16096)

build_msvc: Drop 32-bit build configurations

events.body: Rebased 8c49dc2b7402d6b6b8cd00c4784abf6e86071c30 -> 57b3c5bda648016747553f49b6107fd6c7d90235 ([pr22908.01](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/commits/pr22908.01) -> [pr22908.02](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/commits/pr22908.02)) on top of the recent changes in CI.

Concept ACK. There is no point in supporting this configuration, I'm sure it's wildly under-tested. 32-bit x86 is a museum architecture by now, and accidentally using a 32-bit build on 64-bit hardware will result in lousy performance.
Concept ACK - haven't / wont test though.

Looks good to me. Nice pickup of the duplicate project GUID.

Update: Will test it out this evening.
